Crimes.Crime_Name: Breach of duty to answer truthfully under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer's decision was based on sufficient evidence and procedural fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under Rule 17(b) of Federal Courts Rules
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Perceived lack of credibility due to contradictions with spouse's statements
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral statements, interview notes (missing from record)
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Missing interview notes from applicant’s wife
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to include all relevant materials in certified record
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Procedural fairness and adequacy of reasons
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duty to provide truthful answers and right to procedural fairness
Crimes.Application_Factor: Contradictions regarding combat involvement and contact with spouse
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Use of undisclosed evidence and insufficient basis for credibility finding
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 16, IRPA; Rule 17(b), Federal Courts Rules
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility and inconsistencies in statements
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Withholding of material evidence (spouse's interview notes)
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Breached – applicant denied access to information used against him
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Violation of procedural fairness and reliance on incomplete record
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to disclose relevant documents in judicial review record
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to include interview notes in certified record

Crimes.Crime_Name: Suspected involvement in combat leading to inadmissibility to Canada
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether suspicion of combat involvement was supported by sufficient evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Assessment based on inconsistent statements about military activity
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application rejected due to credibility concerns and potential inadmissibility
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to satisfy officer of admissibility
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Inconsistencies between applicant and spouse’s accounts
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Applicants must answer truthfully; decisions require evidentiary support
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Non-disclosure of key documents (wife's interview notes)
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged participation in armed conflict raising security concerns
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Decision not upheld due to procedural unfairness
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breached – failure to disclose relevant evidence
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Statements about combat involvement and spousal communication
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Lack of access to evidence used in decision-making
Crimes.Court_Result: Remanded for redetermination by new officer
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Reliance on internal assessment without full disclosure
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Setting aside of decision and re-hearing
Crimes.Decision_Authority: Visa Officer, Citizenship and Immigration Canada
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by administrative re-determination
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA sections related to inadmissibility and truthfulness
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections 16 and 34(1)(a) or similar provisions on misrepresentation/inadmissibility
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application with overseas processing
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Decision overturned due to procedural unfairness

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Judicial review of refusal based on alleged misrepresentation
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the refusal based on material misrepresentation violated procedural fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review challenging use of undisclosed evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Found lacking due to contradictions with spouse’s account
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged false statements about combat experience and marital contact
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Undisclosed interview notes affecting credibility analysis
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to disclose material used in decision-making
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Right to know and respond to adverse evidence
Crimes.Application_Factor: Contradictory spousal statements on key facts
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Use of non-disclosed evidence in credibility determination
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 16, IRPA; Rule 17(b), Federal Courts Rules
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Alleged untruthfulness and inconsistencies in testimony
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Violated – no opportunity to address spouse's statements
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Procedural unfairness and lack of transparency
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to include all relevant materials in certified record
Crimes.Omission_Type: Exclusion of critical third-party interview notes
